chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq ", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines: Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts. Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'. Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary. Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided. Example 1: Hypotheses: n, m: nat IHn: m + n = n + m Goal: m + S n = S n + m Proof: ```coq simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto. Qed.``` Example 2: Hypotheses: Goal: forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m ```coq intros n m. induction n. - simpl. auto. - simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto. Qed.``` Solve This Proof State: Hypotheses: X: Type p: list X m: list X l: list X Goal: incl m (l ++ p) -> exists m1 m2 : list X, m ~p m1 ++ m2 /\ incl m1 l /\ incl m2 p Premises: Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename incl : forall A : Type, list A -> list A -> Prop incl_app_app : forall (A : Type) (l1 l2 m1 m2 : list A), incl l1 m1 -> incl l2 m2 -> incl (l1 ++ l2) (m1 ++ m2) Forall2_app_inv_l : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (l1 l2 : list X) (m : list Y), Forall2 R (l1 ++ l2) m -> {m1 : list Y & {m2 : list Y | Forall2 R l1 m1 /\ Forall2 R l2 m2 /\ m = m1 ++ m2}} flat_map_app_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> list Y) (l : list X) (r1 : list Y) (y : Y) (r2 : list Y), flat_map f l = r1 ++ y :: r2 -> exists (l1 : list X) (m1 : list Y) (x : X) (m2 : list Y) (l2 : list X), l = l1 ++ x :: l2 /\ f x = m1 ++ y :: m2 /\ r1 = flat_map f l1 ++ m1 /\ r2 = m2 ++ flat_map f l2 Forall2_app_inv_r : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (l : list X) (m1 m2 : list Y), Forall2 R l (m1 ++ m2) -> {l1 : list X & {l2 : list X | Forall2 R l1 m1 /\ Forall2 R l2 m2 /\ l = l1 ++ l2}} prefix_app_lft_inv : forall (X : Type) (l1 l2 m : list X), l1 ++ l2

{m2 : list X | m = l1 ++ m2 /\ l2

incl l1 m /\ incl l2 m incl_cons_inv : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (l m : list A), incl (a :: l) m -> In a m /\ incl l m incl_cons_linv : forall (l m : list X) (x : X), incl (x :: m) l -> In x l /\ incl m l incl_app : forall (A : Type) (l m n : list A), incl l n -> incl m n -> incl (l ++ m) n incl_tran : forall (A : Type) (l m n : list A), incl l m -> incl m n -> incl l n incl_appl : forall (A : Type) (l m n : list A), incl l n -> incl l (n ++ m) incl_appr : forall (A : Type) (l m n : list A), incl l n -> incl l (m ++ n) incl_cons : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (l m : list A), In a m -> incl l m -> incl (a :: l) m incl_tl : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (l m : list A), incl l m -> incl l (a :: m) In_perm : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (l : list X), In x l -> exists m : list X, x :: m ~p l ListDec.uniquify : forall A : Type, ListDec.decidable_eq A -> forall l : list A, exists l' : list A, NoDup l' /\ incl l l' list_discrim : forall (X : Type) (P Q : X -> Prop), (forall x : X, {P x} + {Q x}) -> forall l : list X, {lP : list X & {lQ : list X | l ~p lP ++ lQ /\ Forall P lP /\ Forall Q lQ}} ListDec.uniquify_map : forall A B : Type, ListDec.decidable_eq B -> forall (f : A -> B) (l : list A), exists l' : list A, NoDup (map f l') /\ incl (map f l) (map f l') Nat.lt_le_trans : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> m <= p -> n < p list_app_eq_inv : forall (X : Type) (l1 l2 r1 r2 : list X), l1 ++ r1 = l2 ++ r2 -> {m : list X | l1 ++ m = l2 /\ r1 = m ++ r2} + {m : list X | l2 ++ m = l1 /\ r2 = m ++ r1} list_app_cons_eq_inv : forall (X : Type) (l1 l2 r1 r2 : list X) (x : X), l1 ++ r1 = l2 ++ x :: r2 -> {m : list X | l1 ++ m = l2 /\ r1 = m ++ x :: r2} + {m : list X | l2 ++ x :: m = l1 /\ r2 = m ++ r1} NoDup_length_incl : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A), NoDup l -> length l' <= length l -> incl l l' -> incl l' l map_app_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (m n : list Y), map f ll = m ++ n -> {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ r /\ m = map f l /\ n = map f r}} Permutation_app : forall (A : Type) (l m l' m' : list A), l ~p l' -> m ~p m' -> l ++ m ~p l' ++ m' FinFun.Surjective_list_carac : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B), FinFun.Surjective f < -> (forall lB : list B, exists lA : list A, incl lB (map f lA)) map_middle_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (m : list Y) (y : Y) (n : list Y), map f ll = m ++ y :: n -> {l : list X & {x : X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ map f l = m /\ f x = y /\ map f r = n}}} incl_map : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l1 l2 : list A), incl l1 l2 -> incl (map f l1) (map f l2) map_duplicate_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (l' : list Y) (y1 : Y) (m' : list Y) (y2 : Y) (r' : list Y), map f ll = l' ++ y1 :: m' ++ y2 :: r' -> {l : list X & {x1 : X & {m : list X & {x2 : X & {r : list X | l' = map f l /\ y1 = f x1 /\ m' = map f m /\ y2 = f x2 /\ r' = map f r /\ ll = l ++ x1 :: m ++ x2 :: r}}}}} list_cons_app_cons_eq_inv : forall (X : Type) (l2 r1 r2 : list X) (x y : X), x :: r1 = l2 ++ y :: r2 -> (l2 = nil /\ x = y /\ r1 = r2) + {m : list X | l2 = x :: m /\ r1 = m ++ y :: r2} incl_Add_inv : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (l u v : list A), ~ In a l -> incl (a :: l) v -> Add a u v -> incl l u

```coq
```coq
intros X p m l H.
apply Forall2_app_inv_l with (m := nil).
rewrite <- H.
apply Forall2_app_inv_r.
Qed.```
